title: trouble creating multianimal training dataset
body:
https://colab.research.google.com/github/MMathisLab/DeepLabCut/blob/master/examples/COLAB_maDLC_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb

i have used conda CPU env in windows os and labelled my dataset in gui. further i edited my config file before running it on google colab notebook.
i tried to use the google colab notebook to try training my videos and encounter the following error 
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ParserError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-707bc42d254f> in <module>()
----> 1 deeplabcut.cropimagesandlabels(path_config_file, size=(400, 400), userfeedback=True)
      2 
      3 #if you labeled on Windows, please set the windows2linux=True:
      4 deeplabcut.create_multianimaltraining_dataset(path_config_file, windows2linux=True)

9 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in cropimagesandlabels(config, numcrops, size, userfeedback, cropdata, excludealreadycropped, updatevideoentries)
    283 
    284     indexlength = int(np.ceil(np.log10(numcrops)))
--> 285     cfg = auxiliaryfunctions.read_config(config)
    286     videos = cfg["video_sets"].keys()
    287 

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/auxiliaryfunctions.py in read_config(configname)
    166         try:
    167             with open(path, "r") as f:
--> 168                 cfg = ruamelFile.load(f)
    169                 # update path to current location of config.yaml (if different)
    170                 if cfg["project_path"] != configname.replace(

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/main.py in load(self, stream)
    341         constructor, parser = self.get_constructor_parser(stream)
    342         try:
--> 343             return constructor.get_single_data()
    344         finally:
    345             parser.dispose()

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/constructor.py in get_single_data(self)
    109         # type: () -> Any
    110         # Ensure that the stream contains a single document and construct it.
--> 111         node = self.composer.get_single_node()
    112         if node is not None:
    113             return self.construct_document(node)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/composer.py in get_single_node(self)
     76         document = None  # type: Any
     77         if not self.parser.check_event(StreamEndEvent):
---> 78             document = self.compose_document()
     79 
     80         # Ensure that the stream contains no more documents.

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/composer.py in compose_document(self)
     99 
    100         # Compose the root node.
--> 101         node = self.compose_node(None, None)
    102 
    103         # Drop the DOCUMENT-END event.

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/composer.py in compose_node(self, parent, index)
    136             node = self.compose_sequence_node(anchor)
    137         elif self.parser.check_event(MappingStartEvent):
--> 138             node = self.compose_mapping_node(anchor)
    139         self.resolver.ascend_resolver()
    140         return node

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/composer.py in compose_mapping_node(self, anchor)
    209         if anchor is not None:
    210             self.anchors[anchor] = node
--> 211         while not self.parser.check_event(MappingEndEvent):
    212             # key_event = self.parser.peek_event()
    213             item_key = self.compose_node(node, None)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/parser.py in check_event(self, *choices)
    138         if self.current_event is None:
    139             if self.state:
--> 140                 self.current_event = self.state()
    141         if self.current_event is not None:
    142             if not choices:

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ruamel/yaml/parser.py in parse_block_mapping_key(self)
    587                 self.marks[-1],
    588                 'expected <block end>, but found %r' % token.id,
--> 589                 token.start_mark,
    590             )
    591         token = self.scanner.get_token()

ParserError: while parsing a block mapping
  in "/content/drive/My Drive/cntnaptest-alok-2020-07-02/config.yaml", line 2, column 1
expected <block end>, but found '<block mapping start>'
  in "/content/drive/My Drive/cntnaptest-alok-2020-07-02/config.yaml", line 13, column 3
```
